Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Pendants
Description: Pendants of an overall elongated shape used in the bead design of a necklace: nine are in the shape of petals or tear-drops, with two suspension rings, and two are oval-shaped, also with suspension rings. Most probably depicting plants (fruits ?), they were strung vertically between two rows of beads in composite necklaces.
